title: Anti-Cholinesterases
author: ayobami
description: how much do you know about the anti-cholinesterases?

questions.question: (B) can go through the blood-brain barrier
questions.text: rivastigmine(A), physostigmine(B), neostigmine(C), donepezil(D), galantamine(E), edrophonium(F), malathion(G), and sarin(H)

questions.question: (H) is used as a drug for atropine overdose
questions.text: rivastigmine(A), physostigmine(B), neostigmine(C), donepezil(D), galantamine(E), edrophonium(F), malathion(G), and sarin(H)

questions.question: (A) is the shortest acting of the above anti-cholinesterases
questions.text: rivastigmine(A), physostigmine(B), neostigmine(C), donepezil(D), galantamine(E), edrophonium(F), malathion(G), and sarin(H)

questions.question: (F) is the shortest acting of the above anti-cholinesterases

questions.question: (G) is used in insecticides, pesticides, e.t.c
questions.text: rivastigmine(A), physostigmine(B), neostigmine(C), donepezil(D), galantamine(E), edrophonium(F), malathion(G), and sarin(H)

questions.question: (A) is indicated for diagnosis of myasthenia gravis
questions.text: rivastigmine(A), physostigmine(B), neostigmine(C), donepezil(D), galantamine(E), edrophonium(F), malathion(G), and sarin(H)

questions.question: (B) is indicated for atropine overdose
questions.text: rivastigmine(A), physostigmine(B), neostigmine(C), donepezil(D), galantamine(E), edrophonium(F), malathion(G), and sarin(H)

questions.question: all the drugs above typically cause increased secretions
questions.text: rivastigmine(A), physostigmine(B), neostigmine(C), donepezil(D), galantamine(E), edrophonium(F), malathion(G), and sarin(H)

questions.question: (A), (D), (E) is indicated for curing Alzheimer's disease

questions.question: all of these drugs are used for disease treatment

questions.question: (A), (D), (E) is indicated for improving quality of life in Alzheimer's disease

questions.question: (A), (B), (E), (C) can go through the blood brain barrier
